{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3280705,"name":"guy","username":"soroka","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/3ab097/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-11T11:43:19.914Z","cooked":"

Hello, I am using advantage kit in a robot program, in the example on the advantage kit github repo they only show how to send the logs to the network table and how to save to a usb stick.
I wondered if there is a way to save the logs directly to the roborioâ€™s storage and then pass it to a connected computer.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-01-11T11:43:19.914Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":189,"reads":186,"readers_count":185,"score":982.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":449427,"topic_slug":"saving-logs-in-advantage-kit","display_username":"guy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/saving-logs-in-advantage-kit/449427/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3280713,"name":"Dan Katzuv","username":"dan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-11T11:56:00.427Z","cooked":"

Itâ€™s possible, you can just pass another path for the log file. However, thereâ€™s limited storage on the roboRIO at only 512MB. Why donâ€™t you want to use a disk-on-key?

Edit: 512MB is for the internal storage, the SD card can be much larger.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-01-11T15:00:41.037Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":42.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":449427,"topic_slug":"saving-logs-in-advantage-kit","display_username":"Dan Katzuv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32004,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5987 Software Mentor ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡±"},"post_url":"/t/saving-logs-in-advantage-kit/449427/2","custom_user_title":"5987 Software Mentor ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡±","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3280728,"name":"guy","username":"soroka","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/3ab097/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-11T12:40:20.251Z","cooked":"

Currently we donâ€™t have any disk on keys and we prefer not to buy some if we donâ€™t need to so we are looking into other options.
We use a roborio2 that uses a micro SD card to boot from so maybe itâ€™s possible to save to it?
If so what will be itâ€™s path?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-01-11T12:40:20.251Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":44.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":449427,"topic_slug":"saving-logs-in-advantage-kit","display_username":"guy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":32004,"username":"dan","name":"Dan Katzuv","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/saving-logs-in-advantage-kit/449427/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3280737,"name":"Dan Katzuv","username":"dan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-11T12:56:01.029Z","cooked":"

Accessing the SD card may be possible, I donâ€™t know the path though. Youâ€™d also need to make sure your laptop can read those.
Disk on keys are super cheap, you can get a 64GB one for â‚ª19 ($5) on KSP. Itâ€™s much better to get a few.

soroka:

We use a roborio2 that uses a micro SD card to boot from so maybe itâ€™s possible to save to it?
If so what will be itâ€™s path?

The path for on-Rio is /home/lvuser/logs.

Multiple tools have the ability to download data logs off the Rio (over the network): AdvantageScope, WPILib DataLogTool, and the DS.

Is there a way to get AdvantageKit to push the log from, say, a match to the DS at the end of teleop?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-10-23T22:04:22.056Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":46.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":449427,"topic_slug":"saving-logs-in-advantage-kit","display_username":"Timothy Ellworth-Bowers","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68642,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2486 Software & Controls Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/saving-logs-in-advantage-kit/449427/11","custom_user_title":"2486 Software & Controls Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3438392,"name":"Jonah Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-23T22:37:26.252Z","cooked":"

See this issue regarding automatic downloading of logs in AdvantageScope. Bandwidth is a major concern regardless of whether the robot or laptop initiates the download, and that problem is massively amplified if you tried to download logs over the field network. The conclusion based on that issue was that this would be best solved by a button in AdvantageScope that detects new logs (potentially only new match logs) and is one click to download everything. But nothing along those lines is currently implemented.
